member.name: IAMVideoCompression.GetInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInfo method retrieves information about the filter's compression properties, including capabilities and default values.

member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives a version string, such as "Version 2.1.0."
Receives the size of the version string, in bytes.
Pointer to a buffer that receives a description string, such as "My Video Compressor."
Receives the size of the description string, in bytes.
Receives the default rate of predicted (P) frames per key frame.
Receives the compression capabilities, as a bitwise combination of zero or more flags.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.get_KeyFrameRate

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_KeyFrameRate method retrieves the current key-frame rate.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the current key-frame rate. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default key-frame rate. If the value is zero, only the first frame is a key frame.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.get_PFramesPerKeyFrame

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_PFramesPerKeyFrame method retrieves the rate of predicted (P) frames per key frame.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of P frames per key frame. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default rate.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.get_Quality

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_Quality method retrieves the current compression quality.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the relative compression quality. The quality is expressed as a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 indicates the best quality and 0.0 indicates the worst quality. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default quality.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.get_WindowSize

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_WindowSize method retrieves the number of frames over which the compressor will maintain the average data rate.

For example, assuming a data rate of 100K/sec and a frame rate of 10 frames per second, if the window size is 1, then every frame will be 10K or less. If the window size is 5, then every five consecutive frames will average 10K per frame, but individual frames may exceed this size.
The default window size is 1.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the window size, expressed as a number of frames.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.OverrideFrameSize

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The OverrideFrameSize method overrides the frame size of a specified frame.

member.param: Specifies the frame number. The first frame that the filter delivers is numbered zero.
Specifies the maximum size of the specified frame, in bytes.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.OverrideKeyFrame

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The OverrideKeyFrame method instructs the filter to compress a particular frame as a key frame.

member.param: Specifies the frame number. The first frame that the filter delivers is numbered zero.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.put_KeyFrameRate

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_KeyFrameRate method sets the key-frame rate.

member.param: Desired key-frame rate. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default key-frame rate. If the value is zero, only the first frame will be a key frame.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.put_PFramesPerKeyFrame

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_PFramesPerKeyFrame method sets the rate of predicted (P) frames per key frame.

member.param: Specifies the number of P frames per key frame. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default rate.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.put_Quality

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_Quality method sets the compression quality.

member.param: Specifies the quality as a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 indicates the best quality and 0.0 indicates the worst quality. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default quality.

member.name: IAMVideoCompression.put_WindowSize

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_WindowSize method sets the number of frames over which the compressor must maintain an average data rate.

For example, assuming a data rate of 100K/sec and a frame rate of 10 frames per second, if the window size is 1, then every frame will be 10K or less. If the window size is 5, then every five consecutive frames must average 10K per frame, but individual frames may exceed this size.

member.param: Specifies the window size, expressed as a number of frames. .

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMVideoCompression interface sets and retrieves video compression properties. It is supported by some video compression filters, and also by some video capture filters that output compressed video. Filters that support this interface expose it through their output pins.
An application can use this interface to control how video is compressed, including characteristics such as the key-frame rate or the compression quality.
A filter that supports this interface might not support every method. Use the method to determine which methods the filter supports.
summary.div: Note To use this interface on a capture filter, you might need to connect the filter to another filter in the graph.
